    • oauth_signature is set to the concatenated encoded values of the Consumer Secret and Token Secret, separated by a '&' character (ASCII code 38), even if either secret is empty. The result MUST be encoded again.

    • OAuth
    • \OAuthSignatureMethodPlainText

    User: zeflasher Date: 23/06/12 Time: 10:33 PM The PLAINTEXT method does not provide any security protection and SHOULD only be used over a secure channel such as HTTPS. It does not use the Signature Base String.

    • Chapter 9.4 ("PLAINTEXT")

     Methods

    oauth_signature is set to the concatenated encoded values of the Consumer Secret and Token Secret, separated by a '&' character (ASCII code 38), even if either secret is empty. The result MUST be encoded again.

    build_signature(\Zeflasher\OAuth\OAuthRequest $request, string $consumer_secret, string $token_secret) : string

    • Chapter 9.4.1 ("Generating Signatures")

    Please note that the second encoding MUST NOT happen in the SignatureMethod, as OAuthRequest handles this!

    Parameters

    $request

    \Zeflasher\OAuth\OAuthRequest

    $consumer_secret

    string

    $token_secret

    string

    Returns

    string

    {@inheritdoc}

    get_name() : string

    Returns

    string
